moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O
comment:
The Muzio Gambit. Such an
audacious Knight sacrifice was already in a manuscript of the end of the 16th
century. Then, for whatever reason, this attack was attributed to the mostly
unknown italian player Muzio D'Alessandro. Funny things like this one are
often present in the Chess Theory. Tartakover, with irony, called it "the
Short-Sighted Lady". Although nowadays nobody is so brave to play this
sacrifice, it is fully justified by the practice and the analysis. White's
play must be very carefull and accurate in order to keep equality.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3 Qf6
comment: Believed to be the best reply.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3 Qf6 7. e5
comment: Typical pawn sacrifice, aiming to open the "e"-file.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3 Qf6 7. e5 Qxe5 8. d3 Bh6 9. Nc3 Ne7 10. Bd2 Nbc6 11. Rae1 Qf5 12. Nd5 Kd8 13. Bc3
comment:
Dubious. Probably such
a move is the result of Chigorin's home analysis, and however was not the best
way to keep the initiative.  After many years 13. Qe2 was found and believed
to be the most energetic move, but soon the theoreticians found also the right
reply for Black 13... Qe6 with the continuation 14. Qf2 (Unclear would be 14.
Nxe7 for 14... Qxe2 15. Nxc6+ bxc6 16. Rxe2 d5 17. Bb3 Be6 and Black has a
light disadvantage.)

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3 Qf6 7. e5 Qxe5 8. d3 Bh6 9. Nc3 Ne7 10. Bd2 Nbc6 11. Rae1 Qf5 12. Nd5 Kd8 13. Bc3 Re8 14. Bf6 Bg5 15. g4
comment:
The following exchange
would have been disadvantageous: 15. Bxg5 Qxg5 16. Nxf4 d6 17.Bxf7 Ne5 and
Black is in very good shape.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. Bc4 g4 5. O-O gxf3 6. Qxf3 Qf6 7. e5 Qxe5 8. d3 Bh6 9. Nc3 Ne7 10. Bd2 Nbc6 11. Rae1 Qf5 12. Nd5 Kd8 13. Bc3 Re8 14. Bf6 Bg5 15. g4 Qg6 16. Bxg5 Qxg5 17. h4 Qxh4 18. Qxf4 d6 19. Nf6 Ne5
comment:
A mistake!  Right was 19... Rf8 20. Re2 Bf5 with exclamation mark,
and White's attack vanishes.
